words.aback:
(n) (obsolete) An abacus.
(adv) By surprise; startled; dumbfounded.
(adv) (nautical) Backward against the mast; said of the sails when pressed by the wind from the 'wrong' (forward) side, or of a ship when its sails are set that way.
words.affine: (adj) (mathematics) Of a function, expressible as [some heavy maths] (which is not linear, but is similar).
words.weave: (v) To form something by passing lengths or strands of material over and under one another.
